page.title: 10LLANGURIG, GOVERNMENT
page.content: At a local level the Parish is the responsibility of the{Llangurig {Community Council.}The{parish}is one of the{biggest in Wales. The council meet in the school at least once every two months. Two meetings a year are public, which means members of the public are allowed to participate. Observations from the council are submitted to the{Montgomery District {Council}and the{Powys County Council. Councillors from these two bodies regularly attend Community Council meetings. { Councillor Hefin Bennett}represents Llangurig on the District Council, and {Councillor Joe Griffiths}on the County Council. The Community Council has{no plenary {powers,}but serves as a{"watch dog" over local affairs.
